alert.note: Alert for Washington (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 14 at 3:52AM CDT until June 14 at 6:00AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 AM CDT FOR SOUTHERN WASHINGTON COUNTY... At 352 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Strickler, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Locations in or near the path include... Elkins... West Fork... Winslow... Brentwood... Strickler... Blackburn... Wyola... Woolsey... Sulphur City... Morrow... Arnett... Hicks... This includes Interstate 49 between mile markers 42 and 53. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Prepare immediately for large hail and deadly cloud to ground lightning. Seek shelter inside a well-built structure. Stay away from windows.
